column2: qŭi ámbulant in viîs ejus. ^ Blessed are all they that fear the Lord

column1: 2 ^ Labóres mánuum tuárum qŭia manducábis~; beátus es
column2: et bène tìbi èrit. ^ For thou shalt eat the labours of thy hands~; blessed art thou
column3: and it shall be well with thee.

column2: in latèribus domûs tuaĕ. Fílii tui sicut novèllaĕ olivárum
column3: in circùmitu mensaĕ tuaĕ. ^ Thy wife as a fruitful vine
column4: on the sides of thy house. Thy children as olive plants

column1: 4 ^ Ecce sic benedicétur hòmo qŭi tìmet Dòminum. ^ Behold
column2: thus shall the man be blessed that feareth the Lord.
et vìdeas bona Jerusalímis òmnibus diébus vitaĕ tuaĕ. ^ May the Lord bless thee out of Sion
column3: and mayst thou see the good things of Jerusalem all the days of thy life.

column2: pacem super Israhélem. ^ And mayst thou see thy children's children
